intro: Amorphophallus palawanensis, commonly known as the Palawan arrowroot, is a tuberous plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Araceae family and is characterized by its large,戟-shaped leaves and a striking, spadix-like inflorescence. The plant produces a single, fleshy tuber that serves as its storage organ. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
